basic_data.name: Bonnie Gordon College of Confectionary Arts

description: Bonnie Gordon College of Confectionary Arts is the place to be to learn everything from baking and pastry arts to cake decorating and cultivating a love for confections! Choose from fun one day classes to certificate and diploma programs. Day classes include subjects in: -Baking & Pastry Arts-Cake Decorating & Design-Sweet Treats-Specialty Skills.

reviews.title: Spending the day making baguettes - Ooh la la
text: Had a great day making different types of bread including baguettes. The instructor's
were very helpful and interesting. We got to take home some lovely loaves. I am signing up to make Parisian macaroons next

reviews.title: Bridal party
text: A group of mothers and daughters hosted a great afternoon at Bonnie Gordons to entertain my daughter (the bride)...we learned to decorate cookies.  Not as easy as one may think!

It was a delightful afternoon.   The school provided amazing instructors who guided us through every step of the process.  The ladies really demonstrated some wonderful creativity...our cookies were beautiful and the process so much fun!

reviews.title: learning chocolate knowledge skill
text: this is very good school can learn how to make chocolate truffles and know about set up temperate they were teaching very good and excellent tool can let you learning .....if you are interested in chocolate u must to join this class ..... i had fun here

reviews.title: Designer Cakes Certificate Program
text: Where do I begin! It has always been my dream to attend Bonnie Gordon College of Confectionary Arts and once the first day of class begun and I was officially a student with my uniform on and cake tools ready to go I never felt happier! I went into this program with self taught knowledge about cake decorating and knew this program would be beneficial for me in furthering my skills. This program did exactly that! The amount of knowledge I learned along with hands on skills has brought my cakes to a whole new level. Everyday we would have practical and written tests which I found very helpful in giving us the maximum learning experience. The staff and teachers were beyond nice and helpful. They truly do make you feel as if you are part of the Bonnie Gordon Family and I loved that! Being enrolled in the 8 week program was probably one of the happiest times I have ever felt being at school. I finally felt I was where I was meant to be. Advice for cake artists who are thinking about doing this program-100% do it! No matter your skill level the teachers do an amazing job guiding you along the way and helping you bring your skill to a more professional level. I am forever greatful for the 8 weeks I spent at Bonnie Gordon! I learnt so much, and met some pretty amazing people! Here are some photos of my cakes that I completed while in the program.
Thanks and happy baking :)
Ana-Cristina from Toronto.

reviews.title: Skills you can take home!
text: I took the cupcake decorating class and it was very educational. I learned a lot and had fun. They were professional, nice and very helpful, giving hands-on advice. I recommend it for anyone who likes sweets!

reviews.title: Cupcake class was fun and educational
text: I found this school on a Groupon site and they had a good deal for a class for two and this was something I always wanted to try with my university aged daughter when she returned home.  She loves to bake and is a bit more patient and talented than I am so her cakes turned out better too.  I found it a bit hard to process the directions and I didn't seem to catch on as much as others, but I was able to produce a decent finished product at the end.  We were given enough time to practice each technique but only about 25 minutes to decorate 6 cupcakes at the end, so I did feel a bit rushed, and we were also sharing some of the icing bags.  I would consider taking other courses at this school.  Their facilities and photos of what some of their graduates have created was impressive.  Worth the money and it was great to spend time with my daughter, who really enjoyed it and is looking forward to trying out her new techniques soon at home!

reviews.title: Amazing learning experience!
text: I did several back to back programs at the school and could not believe how much I was learning. Everyday was an amazing learning experience.  Great instructors with very professionally designed programs. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: The Best of the Best
text: I took the designer cake certificate 8 week course and I could not have asked for more! Everyone at the college it very helpful and the instructors are extremely skilled and talented. Bonnie herself is very involved ensuring a successful experience for all students. The college is very well run from office services, supplies, instruction and overall daily flow. You will certainly get your moneys worth out of any class. I highly recommend for anyone with any kind of interest in cake decor and baking. It is worth a special trip to Toronto. Can't be beat.

reviews.title: More than expected!
text: The staff are professional, friendly and very supportive. They are masters of their skills and very willing to share their own knowledge. They provide a comprehensive view into the world of cake making -- not only do you learn how to make beautiful cakes you also gain the necessary skill sets to start your own business. The teachers are not just teachers but also artists! Whether you are a newbie or somewhat trained I would highly recommend this course!! I want to say thank you to all of the teachers. I had a fantastic time!!

reviews.title: Amazing Cake School
text: If you want to learn the art of making something beautiful, then this is the place for you. Thats their mission statement and its so true!
A well ran course for those who want to take their career of baking to the next level. Professional teachers and staff who want to help you flourish to leave there feeling confident and fulfilled.

Taking the programme gives you experience and weeks of tuition to fine tune your skills, and to ask as many questions you have. Ive spent money in the past attending day courses to only learn a few skills, this course is something those who want to take it seriously as a profession won't go wrong with enrolling at this great confectionary school.

reviews.title: I recommend it 100%.
text: I went to BGC  expecting the best and I had that and more. The staff is amazingly friendly and they are always ready to help you with everything you need. Bonnie Gordon is always there, taking care of the excellence!!. Teachers are truly artists and they share with you all their knowledge. It's a college where they encourage you to challenge yourself and be creative.
I am very happy that I took the decision to go and I recommend it 100%.
Carla Ojeda-Ortega
Sweets & Cakes

reviews.title: Amazing Experience! You won't be disappointed.
text: As a recent graduate of the Bonnie Gordon College of Confectionary Arts, I can tell you first hand that Bonnie and her staff provide you with the professional skill set, knowledge and confidence to excel in the world of culinary arts. It has been such a pleasure to be a part of something so amazing.

After completing the Confectionary Arts Diploma program, what I can say that sets the Bonnie Gordon College apart from other institutions is the ability from the teachers and staff to make the whole process fun and enjoyable. It's hard work, but everyday I went in and enjoyed it! The curriculum is so extensive, I had the ability to not only learn how to refine my decorating skills to become a cake designer, but also learned to make sweets I never thought I would be able to do before. Some examples of the amazing things I have learned while in the program include (but are not limited to) candy and bonbon making, baking for allergies (i.e.: gluten and nut free baking), ensuring cakes and cupcakes were baked perfectly and moist, macarons, petit fours and rochers, cookies and sugar art. However, aside from this part of the learning, what initially made me decide to attend the Bonnie Gordon College was the fact not only do you learn the baking and decorating aspect, but the business side of things. Bonnie has professionals and specialists in the industry come in to discuss  and answer questions on how to start your own business, what risks and factors to be aware of and what type of business would be best for your own needs. The college follows up with their students to see their level of success post-graduating and even helps to find employment for those interested.
All in all, my experience at the college was great and I would recommend it to anyone interested in becoming a culinary success!

reviews.title: Best decision I've ever Made!
text: I was looking for a course where I could improve and be more professional in my work, before I opened a business. The Diploma in confectionery arts was exactly what I was looking for. I learned so many new techniques and how to perfect my existing skills.   It wasn't cheap, but it was the best money I've ever spent. My business is growing and getting better every day.

reviews.title: Great school
text: Bonnie Gordon College was for me a great experience. I went there with lots of expectations and learned more than I expected. The teachers and the staffs are very nice and welcoming. We learn from high skills professionals and leave the school with professionnal skills. I recommend the school to everyone, from home baking mom to professionals like me who wants to extend there art!

reviews.title: I keep an amazing memory about the Bonnie Gordon School
text: I keep a great memory of my time in the Bonnie Gordon School
it was a very rewarding experience, I learned a lot and took a lot of confidence after this training, since I build my business.
it was very intense with well filled days with Professor tuned and highly qualified.
Very complete training, I would I liked to stay one or two weeks to extend the dream

reviews.title: My dream has come true!
text: Studying at Bonnie Gordon College was one of the most amazing experiences in my life! When I met the school at the Canada's Baking and Sweets Show in 2012, I found out how one beautiful cake could be made of sugar art. I was amazed! So, I decided to follow my dream to become a Cakes Designer at  Bonnie Gordon College.

The most amazing part was that everything that I dreamed became true. Every day I learned something new and beautiful. I took the full time program and it really was full time. From Monday to Friday every week I finished exhausted of hard working, and that's what I loved the most. The compromise of the school is also to teach you how to succeed in your business and the program is designed to help you on that. But for me is something as simple as that once you enter the school you feel the magic there, and that's what inspires every student that choose to follow this path in the fantastic word of the sugar art.
